  • Adventures in bullshit

Markdown and Kramdown

This is all just a bastardized version of this from Daring Fireball.

Github pages only supports Kramdown if you even care. But if you are using a jekyll specific site this will probably need to be mentioned in the _config.yml file like so:

# Markdown
markdown: kramdown

Headings

# h1
## h2
### h3
#### h4
##### h5
###### h6

Emphasis

*em*

**strong**

Lists

+ li

    + li

1. ol

Links

[I'm an inline-style link](https://www.google.com)

[I'm an inline-style link with title](https://www.google.com "Google's Homepage")

[I'm a relative reference to a repository file in the root](/images/russell.jpg)

I’m an inline-style link

I’m an inline-style link with title

I’m a relative reference to a to a repository file in the root

![jack in coat](/images/russell.jpg "Jack in coat title")

You can also just do it the old fashioned way if you want classes

Code

`code in an inline block` with basic backticks

code in a block

Or you can indent 4 spaces / tab twice for a block

Blockquotes

>I'm a blockquote and I can use *markdown*

I’m a blockquote and I can use markdown

It's 2016 in case you live on the moon.
